metadata.title: CVE-2019-11763 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Failure to correctly handle null bytes when processing HTML entities resulted in Firefox incorrectly parsing these entities. This could have led to HTML comment text being treated as HTML which could have led to XSS in a web application under certain conditions. It could have also led to HTML entities being masked from filters - enabling the use of entities to mask the actual characters of interest from filters. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 70, Thunderbird < 68.2, and Firefox ESR < 68.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-11763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.2.0+build1.1-0ubuntu1').
